Reviews.Title: “Good enough but beware.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1704
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip to Berlin in April. Overall, the room was spacious and clean. It had all the things as advertised. Internet access in the room was for extra charge, whilst free Wi-Fi could be used in the lobby. Breakfast offered plenty of choice to please everybody. Location-wise, a tube station was 3 mins walk and Brandenburg Tor about 20 mins walk away. However I would warn people about the following: 1. the bathroom provides hand/body wash only (apart from towels). No shampoo/body lotion or any other of the usual bits are provided. 2. the hotel was very busy due to several school trips staying there. This caused a delay at breakfast time as the tables weren't cleaned fast enough. Also the students were very busy at night, in the hallways, running up and down the stairs etc. 3. when we arrived at about 11pm, the receptionist informed us that due to an earlier problem with their booking system they oversold their rooms and hence they will have to provide us with a different accommodation just down the road, just for one night. Note: I paid for my room in advance! However we were adamant to stay in one hotel for the whole stay and refused to go anywhere else just for one night. The receptionist made a phone call and miraculously two rooms became available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: KajaKi
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, nice and practical. Service very nice. Location good, buses and metros nearby. Good breakfast included. Everything was there what you need in cityholiday. Only one clame: computer in the reception war very very slow, and you have to wait, wait, wait. And because the printer was not set in "first selection", many people did not know what to do... then receptionist have to help, and you have to wait...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mattan B
Reviews.Content: Basic rooms, a little beat small (and the bed too!) But the hotel is nice, clean, situated in a relatively good location in the center, about 4 minutes walk to the nearest bus station. Good breakfast in included. Overall, a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: SINGARAMMOHAN
Reviews.Content: centrally located ,good for business travel,hospitality was very good ,nice selection of break fast,,no frills simple hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located. Great Croissants!”
Reviews.Author: TheCaliTraveler
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice property in berlin and the HI EX was consistent with what I expected. There aren't many frills in this type of lodging but they do a much better job at presenting a clean modern room than many smaller independent hotels. I also enjoyed the breakfast - although no real hot items the variety was good and for some reason the croissants were to die for! Location is also great. Walking distance to Potzdamer Place, Sony Centre, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall monument, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anorak Ray
Reviews.Content: I used my Priority Club points to book 3 nights at this hotel and my in-laws came along to keep us company (they had to pay for their room though :-) Having been to Berlin only once a couple of months after the wall came down, I knew nothing about the area, what the hotel would be like or anything else. We arrived late afternoon and were immediately struck by the friendliness and efficiency of the reception staff. I felt the need to practise my German which is rather poor and they were patient with me and helped me when I got stuck. They could have just changed to English because all the staff were much better in English than I was in German! The room itself was the usual basic HIE room but comfortable and spotlessly clean. As usual, the room was too warm so we kept the window open (we also enjoy fresh air) but it is a busy road so we struggled a bit to sleep the first night. After that, we had got used to the noise and slept like logs. Breakfast was superb. On two of the mornings, it was very busy but the personnel were continually refreshing the food, breads and juices. The food was fresh and tasty, the coffee hot and generally, more so as it is part of a very reasonable price, the breakfast is excellent. The bar is small and, if the reception is busy you may have to wait a bit for service but they will get to you as soon as they possibly can. Prices are what you would expect to pay in an hotel and not too much over the top. The hotel is very close to many of the tourist sites, both those in the guide books and those that do not rate a mention. The Topographie des Terrors Documentation Centre is just around the corner; Checkpoint Charlie is just a 5 to 10 minute stroll away and don't forget to go to Fassbender & Rausch chocolate factory just a couple of minutes from CC. Even if you do not eat chocolate, some of the things they do with it are fantastic. Take your camera with you. A little hint, if you want to go to the Reichstag (more commonly known as the Bundestag now) you must make a booking on-line (https://visite.bundestag.de/BAPWeb/pages/createBookingRequest.jsf?lang=en). Best to do this at least 3 days before to make sure that you can get a convenient time. They will send you a confirmation e-mail and you need to print this out and take it with you. Also make sure that you take photographi id with you - passport or drivers licence. We got there about 30 minutes before our entry time and were allowed straight in but in peak tourist periods they may not be quite as flexible. All I can say is do not let the preparation admin put you off because it is well worth it and it is free after all. There are a couple of really good restaurants very close to the hotel (it only does breakfast but has no problem with you bringing in take-aways if that it what you want). I can recommend the Cafe Stresemann (cash only - no cards) which does German food cooked freshly when you order and the Diomira Italian restaurant (if you are in the back part of this restaurant, your card will probably not work but there is usually no problem in the front - guess it must just be the signal). Back to the hotel, we checked out Saturday morning although our flight was only later in the afternoon. The hotel has a locked luggage room where they will keep your luggage for you until you are ready to go. Gave us a chance to have another walk around and even discover something which we had missed in the previous 2 days! To sum up, Berlin is a must to visit and we plan to go back again in the near future; the Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre is an ideal place to stay if you are on a budget, the staff are excellent, the beer is quaffable, the food edible (helps if, like me, you enjoy German food which can be quite stodgy), the public transport excellent and most things are easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: emandernie
Reviews.Content: 9 minutes from Potsdamer Platz says it all. Rooms are bright but minimalistic to the extreme. The bed is a bit hard (and we like hard beds) so welcome to Germany. Tight for two people if you plan to spend more than a day or two. Friendly and very helpful front staff. Decent breakfast. The place was full so it is more a business hotel than for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hibee07
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel on a short break to Berlin with a group of fiends in February 2012. The hotel is in a good location, the staff were friendly and professional. The rooms are good sized compered to some hotels across Germany. Most visitor sites can be reached very easily either by walking 10-15 mins to checkpoint Charlie or by U-Bahn from Anhalter Strasse station (2Mins away from hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Stresemannstrasse 49 Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and comfortable. German staff with East German attitude. Charge 14 euros for early check in but no refund for early check out. Add 4 hours internet usage to your bill even if you don't use it, so challenge that. All the housekeeping staff are Asian.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient place in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I spend a few nights at the Holiday Inn with my family while exploring Berlin for the first time. This is a standard Holiday Inn Express property. The hotel seems recently renovated. Rooms and bathrooms are simple but functional and extremely clean. Beds are good but nothing fancy. Staff is friendly. Free wi fi in the lobby and complimentary buffet breakfast. The location is good, in a quiet street but within walking distance to Potsdamer Platz (about 10 min), with shops, restaurantes and the subway. If you like walking you can easily reach Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate and other attractions. There're also a few restaurantes and a supermarket just meters away from the hotel. The hotel also has onsite parking for about 7 EUR per day, which is highly convenient if you've a car. I highly recommend staying here, it's a no-frills, comfortable budget hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect centre to work from”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandRob
Reviews.Content: Having stopped at this hotel a couple of times I can say it is clean, value for money and perfectly situated to explore the city. A short walk from a both U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations that give full coverage of the city and outreaches. Very friendly and helpful staff made the visits very pleasant experiences. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin. There are parking spaces but you need to book these seperately.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money & Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: ralphbap
Reviews.Content: Clean, good value, reasonable, nice breakfast, parking. A good base for exploring Berlin. Very close to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: faceman6
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights in Berlin at the Holiday Inn Express. The reception staff were very friendly and courteous and happy to securely store our luggage until we could check in later in the day. The room itself was fine; fairly basic but did the job for a short break - our bathroom was a wet room style, which some people might not like, but was fine for us though. The rooms were quite warm though and changing the temp/fan settings didn't seem to do much, but it wasn't a major issue. Breakfast was satisfactory as I knew what to expect; just a selection of meats, cheese and the usual continental stuff, but seeing as it was included with the room and still cheaper than other hotels in the area I was happy. It's less than a 10 min walk to Potsdamer Platz and to Checkpoint Charlie so is well located and the general area felt safe, if not the most lively. Overall, a good value for money hotel, well located for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Crisis time hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pifon
Reviews.Content: I've been in Berlin for 5 days, unfortunately staying in this hotel. Only reception people deserves appreciation. They were kind, helpful and what most important - professional. The rest about this hotel is disaster. Old room with stains on carpet. TV with magic function - to change volume it is not enough to press volume up/down button - it has no effect. I discovered, that going to 'menu' function (which actually is disabled) enables volume change button (seriously) Air-con noisy with no effect on changing temperature. It heats all the time. Only potion is to turn it off. Heating/cooling - no effect. Only increasing noise on fan mode 1-3 reacts. Bizzare toilet doors which are apparently fingers crackers. (seriously be really careful). Welcome surprise - shower is set to maximum hot water - which is nearly boiling! Just malicious behave of houskeeping mates. Another malicious behaviour was that after 2 days of using free sachets of regular coffee it was replenished with decaffeinated - seems like attempt of cutting usage. There was no option - I had to buy my own from nearby Netto shop. Breakfast - only cold sandwich meat, lots of type of bread, some hard boiled eggs, jam and cereals, tea, coffee, milk - nothing impressive. 'Non smoking' hotel - so guests have to crowd in front (at December in Berlin is about 2 deg C) to smoke a cigarette. (otherwise 200 euro fine) No utensils - toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, shaving tools. There is an information, saying 'if you forgotten something - ask in reception' - I couldn't be bothered. So I bought my own in nearby 'Spate Kauf' shop from nice Asian guy. I am just wondering, as I had no iron with me - will they expect to carry that?! There was no iron in room. Basically, as I wrote before everything, except reception stuff seems to try to make your day bad and make you feel unwelcome. It was a business trip so I had no choice, but will never ever choose it by myself. I strongly NOT RECOMMEND this place.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located. Clean room. Freindly staff. Boring breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ace_dubai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located near the Anhalter Bahnhof Station (S-Bahn). It's less than 5 minute walk away from the hotel, from there you can easily jump on to the S1, S2, S25 Green & Pink lines to Friedrich Strasse Station that is very well connected to the rest of the city and quiet central too. Very quiet room and friendly staff. The breakfast can get very crowded, so please check with the reception for best off-peak times, that is only in case you are not under time pressure or on a business trip. There is some room for improvement in the quality of breakfast served.. the breakfast was very boring and remained the same on all days that I stayed there (4 nights). I was a little bit disappointed to not find any fresh cut fruits.. but leaving these things aside.. This is a very good hotel and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good For the Money”
Reviews.Author: MartinStoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the later part of April 2011 for three nights. Rooms were clean and comfortable as you would expect for a Holiday Inn Express. The rooms were smaller than North American rooms but quite spacious. Front counter personnel were helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was good with lots of fresh fruit and cereals. Not too far a walk to shopping and restaurants. I'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: alberdetravel
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel in a location thats within easy walking distance to all places of interest.Rooms are very clean and spacious, continental breakfast very good selection.The staff on reception spoke very good english and polite.Now the bad part of our trip was the journey from the airport to centre of berlin,no english translation on the train ticket machines or travel information at the time we went trains were disrupted no one to talk to on station.The saving grace of this was the friendliness of the german people we met who went out of there way to help .

Reviews.Title: “not all that good”
Reviews.Author: shan g
Reviews.Content: well, It wasnt horrible, but I am SUPER easy to please and dont expect something out of this world when traveling... but ummm, this one was not so good. My little son son was so excited to go swimming, uh, no pool, staff not all that cool (at least to us), and rooms kinda crappy, and the TV thing was an issue AND they put me way down the hall from my teenage girls UGH I was worried all night... not very memorable place... skip it if you can

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel a few times for some business trips. The hotel is right in the center and it is very convenient to travel around from there. The hotel is simple but you'll find everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, perfect accommodations, location so-so, and...”
Reviews.Author: jabnolla
Reviews.Content: We were a party of six on family vacation. Accommodations were nicely suited, apparently recently remodeled. However, we would have appreciated changing of sheets since we travelled with a two year old. The location is walking distance from checkpoint Charlie and other central area sights. However, the immediate surroundings of the hotel are uneventful. We also had an incident with a member of the front desk one evening, she ad owned one of my family members from taking a cup of coffee from the open restaurant. She rudely said it should be the last time, and we clarified that in the states coffee is generally available 24/7. After we complained she was disrespectful, she admitted someone else should have cordoned off the restaurant area, but had not done so that afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be close to tourist interest with average hotel it is the place”
Reviews.Author: oudi
Reviews.Content: We are 2 adults and 3 children. The hotel is good. Clean and city centre . good breakfast. close to metro and every thing you need . Ten minutes walk from berlin gate. But the problem was it is too noisy at night especially if you stay in low floors.alot of people are stay late at night in open place in the first floor. Another problem that the hotel even they have your credit card number but they make somthing strange they make deposite on your card for every night which make you confused and not relaxed. As whole it was good stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Mahocky
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I also can't stop laughing at some of the negative reviews. "There's only one English language tv channel!" Yes I suppose if you go to one of the most amazing cities in the world to sit in your room watching tv, then BBC World News probably does become a bit repetitive. "There's no Leisure Centre!" Who said there was??? Enough of that. We are seasoned travellers and have stayed in all types of accomodation in many different countries from the really good to the truly awful. For the price this place is unbeatable. The hotel itself is modern, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The rooms have all the mod cons you'd expect and was cleaned every day. All staff we spoke to were very friendly and helpful. You can ask them anything, if they don't know the answer they'll find someone who does. I loved the breakfast! It's a buffet with too many things to mention. Basically, there's everything and it keeps on coming. Even with the hotel completely full there's no major queueing involved. Again for the price we paid, the location is excellent. There are lots of little bars and restaurants all around. It takes 10 minutes to walk to Potsdamer Platz from the hotel. And from there another 5 minute walk to The Brandenburg Gate. Take a good look at a street map of Berlin (free at reception) and you'll realise that you're actually within walking distance to a lot of the major tourist attractions. If walking isn't your thing, the Underground train system (U Bahn) is excellent and very easy to figure out. The nearest station to the hotel is 'Mockerbrucke' and it's a 10 minute stroll away. Berlin was amazing. One of the most exciting cities in the world. We really loved it and choosing this hotel turned out to be an excellent decision.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff and very satisfactory stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: dahubbz
Reviews.Content: From start to end this was a remarkable hotel for the price. The staff were always available to answer any queries, from receptionist, breakfast staff or bar staff. I will also mention that our room was cleaned daily, fresh towels and fresh sheets every other day. The room had everything you could ask for,in reception there was even an ice machine for guests and a shoe cleaning machine. We were on the sixth floor and our beds were extremely comfortable. Lastly let me mention breakfast, it is a buffet style breakfast of meats, cheese, fruit, yogurts,juices, rolls, breads, cereals, croissants and doughnuts. These may need to be replaced and are regularly. I just wish some people would have a minute or two patience as this is a busy hotel. Remember it is an all you can eat buffet. I would like to thank all the staff and management for an extremely pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: vulcan88
Reviews.Content: Bright, clean and very pleasant, Staff very helpful and cheerful.Rooms are clean and comfortable with thoughtful facilities, like wake up alarm on tv and tea making..Breakfast could become boring if staying more than four days, but was continually replenished.Enjoyed our stay here very much. M41 bus runs in front of the hotel and both underground and over train are nearby and useful.A comfortable hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ragged and rough around the edges. I wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: h-dog78
Reviews.Content: This hotel does offer a free breakfast, but it's far from spectacular. The hotel seemed very crowded, and there were no ammenities, such as a fitness center. The bedding and towels are threadbare, and the hallway on my floor had no lights. It is conveniently located about a 10 minute walk from shopping and attractions, as well as being right across the street from a really good (reasonably-priced) restaraunt, but so is the hotel next door, which is where I will be staying next time.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: visitor322352
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was poor. There were no adequate personals on the restaurant. Always croissants and other things run out. There were either other sweet cakes to take with cafe. Locazion is ok, nearby train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with bad client attitude”
Reviews.Author: zetanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 5 nights. Hotel is a proper 3 stars hotel. You get what you pay for. located close to a central subway station and within walking distance to Potzdamer Platz. Rooms OK and breakfast sufficient. However the promised free internet system was slow and emails could not be opened. Everyone was complaining and the staff remarked that it was the intent of the manager not to make the system available to the guests.This is utterly unacceptable and left a very bad impression. Will not recommend this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nikkiemotions8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean. However we found it a little way out of the main sites and not too nice at night! Also the breakfast very poor! cheap food and like a cattle market! Running out of things all the time and not good! The staff not very friendly and quite aloof! Also the air conditioning did not work during the night-kept switching itself off! No storage room really either. Would not use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: montgod
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a basic hotel with free continental breakfast (European style). Nice affordable prices for Europe and in a decent area close to all the sites. Rooms were small, but not too bad. Only real complaints were that the beds were a bit uncomfortable (especially the pull-out sofa style bed) and the air conditioner policy (heat automatically is available if it's colder outside even if it is stuffy on the inside - can't open windows cause bugs will eat you alive). Front desk folks aren't really helpful so don't expect much. I actually asked one of the food servers for travel advice and they were pretty helpful. All in all... you get what you pay for so not a bad option. One good tip, from the front of the hotel, keep going straight and make a right at the very next street and park on the street instead of paying to use hotel parking (16 Euro). We had no problems finding parking and it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Fab,Fab,Fab-great value, can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elsava
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is part of a chain which usually means you can expect a certain standard and also due to its location. So glad we made the right decision...! Clean and comfortable; pleasant reception staff and brilliant plentiful breakfast to set you up for the day. My only slight concern was room very warm and aircon not too effective but no big deal...We never used public transport but walked everywhere e.g. a very leisurely 30min walk to Brandenburg Gate via Potsdamer Platz - but appreciate that it might not be possible for people with walking limitations. One thing I don't remember seeing on any reviews prior to our visit was the bikes everywhere!! You have really got to watch out for the cycle paths right in the middle of the pavements! We have been raving about the hotel and our stay to everyone since we got back. Plenty of cheap bars and restaurants in the vicinity. All in all, this hotel is one I would recommend to anyone going to Berlin - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: macadams127
Reviews.Content: Easy transport links from the airport. Central location for sightseeing as everything is within walking distance. Excellant Italian restaurant across the road and just 5 mins walk away the Stadklause pub for a relaxing beer or wine. A further 5 minute walk is the Sony Centre and I can recommend the Australian Restaurant or Jostys. My 2nd visit to Berlin staying at this hotel and it won,t be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Lisadollcollector
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in your hotel. The staff was very helpfull. My only complaint was the TV, lack of english and the pay per view was a disapointment, advertised as 24 hours for 13 euros when there was only 1 english movie in 24 hours! We all live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Wery good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saija_10
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed 4 nights at this hotel in March 2011 and everything was just excellent. Our room was nice, big enough for two, clean and quiet. The location of this hotel is very good and breakfast was many-sided. And staff was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bkeirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for 3 days over a weekend. The room was fine and the beds were extrenely comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was good. The hotel is very well located. On arrival at Schonefeld Airport we took the airport express to the Hauptbahnhof, then left at the Europaplatz exit and caught the M41 bus across the road. It stops a few minutes walk away from the hotel - best stop is Willi Brandt Haus. On our return home there was a possible strike on the S Bahn so we caught the U Bahn at Möckernbrücke station at the back of the hotel to Rüdow and then the X9 bus to the airport. This has the benefit of dropping you off right at the terminal avoiding a longish walk in the biting wind from the S Bahn station. We used public transport almost exclusively - it is so easy to use. The 100 and 200 buses take you past most of the mains sights, and we used them during the day and in the evening to see Berlin-by-Night. The M29 from the Anhalter Bahnhof takes you to the Kudamm for shopping and stops right outside KaDeWe on Tauentzienstrasse, which is great place to ogle luxury goods!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: instoreman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Berlin for two nights in February. The hotel is within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Place. Netto is just across the street and is by far the cheapest place to stock up on drinks and snacks. Our room was pretty much the same as in any other Holiday Inn Express although was too hot as the air conditioning was not working. With below-zero temperatures outside, opening the window soon fixed the problem. The buffet breafast was excellent with a good choices of bread, cereals, cheeses and cooked meats etc. Definitely a good base for visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: diederik82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a very good rate (2 for 1) in January 2011 which made it brilliant value for a 4 night stay. The Holiday Inn Express is a typical European HIX hotel. Basic rooms, simple free breakfast, basic service. Rooms are a bit Ikea-like but nothing wrong with it. Perfectly suitable for 3* Hotel. Beds are on the small side and could be more comfy though. Shower pressure decent, but not great (6th floor). Location: The location of the HIX Berlin City Centre is very good - although the street itself is rather dull and nothing special, but in a couple of minutes you are at Anhalter Bahnhof, where you can take various S-Bahn lines, or you can walk in about 10 minutes to Potsdammer Platz, where you can take S-Bahn, U-Bahn and RE lines. Also bus stops within a few minutes walk from the hotel. Pretty much all major attractions in Berlin (the city doesn't have a real city center - they are quite spread out over the city) can be reached in max 15-20 minutes travel in total. This makes the hotel a perfect location to explore the great city of Berlin! Priority Club: Did not get anything as Platinum member of Priority Club (not even after asking about it). I know they can't upgrade me as they only have one room type, so that's fine - but free/discounted internet, a drink voucher, anything really would have been nice. I really don't like the IHG hotels who ignore platinum status. As PC Member (any status) she said we would get a newspaper, but 4 days in a row and I've never seen one. Staff: Most staff was friendly, spoke English very well and helped us with whatever we needed. Girl at reception even complimented about the good rate we got, so I suppose we did get a good deal :) Summary: Positives: - Free breakfast (basic) - Central location - with public transport you're at all major spots in no time (24/7 public transport!). Never had to use a taxi! - Free Wi-Fi in lobby (see negatives though) - Good value for money - Rooms are in good condition - Friendly, English speaking staff Negatives: - Internet in-room too expensive (15 EUR per day or 4 EUR per hour) - Absolutely no Priority Club Platinum benefits - Old CRT tv's with limited English channels - Beds on the small side - No hot items with breakfast (I thought all HIX's had hot items now as well in Europe?)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: sleepzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on new years eve. Stunning location for brandenburg gate. Really enjoyed our stay here. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and we felt sad to move onto our next hotel. Room was a bit pokey but location made it easy to not spend too much time there. Happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: jonev
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in early December 2010. Although the room we had was not the biggest, we found it adequate for our needs. The room was warm and very clean. Even though our room faced the main road, with the double glazed windows closed there was almost no road noise. We found the staff we encountered very pleasant and helpful, especially one of the receptionists who was extremely helpful when we needed to book an unexpected early return flight. The buffet breakfast was very good, with a good selection at all times. The location was very good, only 10 min walk to Potzdammer Platz & the Sony Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value - Holiday Inn Express at it's best”
Reviews.Author: FergusMum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my teenage son and great value hotel. Rooms, breakfast and amenities usual Holiday Inn Express standard. Very helpful staff who sorted out my problem with boarding passes for return flight home when I got them soaked!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Margrove
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3rd stay at this hotel. Friendly reception staff, quick check in. Rooms clean, bright & comfortable for a short stay. Breakfast more than adequate- continental style but with meats, cheese & boiled eggs. All buffet with limitless coffee/tea and juices. Room has shower gel and hotel will supply forgotten essentials such as razor blades etc. Ideal when there are limits on liquids in hand baggage. 10 mins walk from potsdammer plats. Restaurants and bars close by. Do try the Mexican - Morenos near the anhalter banhoff. Recommended from a previous review, We ate there both nights. Tip. If arriving into schoenfeld, take the x7 bus to rudow and then the u-bahn to mocken bruke. This is the most direct and quickest route. Bus stops outside of the terminal and drops you at the u-bahn. Once off the subway, its Only a 15 min walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing -initiatally”
Reviews.Author: Anndeedee
Reviews.Content: I Booked this hotel back in July and specifically asked for 3 double rooms non smoking all together as we were 3 couples. What did we get on arrival. 3 twin rooms all SMOKING and all split up albeit on the same floor. when I went down to complain the reception chap was ages looking at his computer screen and finally after some hassle we got 3 double rooms non smoking but still not exactly together. to cap it all as well no apology at all from him. As this was booked back in July I do think they could have accomodated us with our request without me having to fight for it. Why seeing as they did have the rooms available couldn't they have given us what we asked for in the first place??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again”
Reviews.Author: james27
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the wonderful Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre. The location is excellent for visiting the sites of berlin as its a few mins walk to Potsdamm Platz and the U and S Bahn station at Anhalter Bahnhof. There is a great bus service next to the station to to take you to the Ku Damm The hotel was amazingly clean and the staff were always helpful and said hello everytime you walked in. The room was very spacious and just what we needed for our stay. We will definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel not far from Potsdamerplatz”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: Although the Holiday Inn Express is the less expensive brand from IHG, the hotel is very modern and rooms are well equipped. About 7 mins walk from AnhalterBahnhof S-Bahn and about 15 mins. to Potsdamer Platz (U and S - Bahn stations + shopping arcades and cinema centres etc. Breakfast is included in all rates - self-service, buffet - not a large choice but adequate. A reasonable choice of restaurants nearby. Staff are helpful. Bar but no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: redegraw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, City Centre on all of my trips to Berlin. It is a friendly, clean and very well managed hotel. It is very near to the Anhalter Bahnhof, which is convenient for all destinations in and around Berlin. The hotel staff are always very accomodating and the morning's continental breakfast is a great way to start the day. This hotel will always be my first choice when visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skullmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights during a trip to Berlin in Nov 2008. Selected hotel based on value and ratings. Pros: Decent location in the city and good value. Hotel was crowded with tours (may be a negative for some) but reception was pleasant and efficient. Fairly convenient to the metro system and the bus. Cons: Very small rooms for an extended stay. Probably better locations in the city for accessing the sites at comparable value. Overall, I would stay again but not before looking at hotels with slightly better location and room size.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Uilleann
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my Berlin visit, based on the good TripAdvisor reviews, and once again wasn't disappointed. The hotel appears very new, everything's shining and clean. The room is minimalistic with just about what you might need for a short stay; the futuristic shower controls are like nothing I've ever seen, somewhat resembling a motorcycle's gas handles, with the water temperatures printed in centigrade... anyone who visits Berlin these days might think that the alien spaceships have finally landed, and this hotel is no exception. Pros: - Breakfast buffet with bread/cheese/cereals and coffee. - Walking distance to the S-Bahn (Anhalter Bhf) and U-Bahn (Kochstr.) stations, plus a bus (M41) which goes to the central rail station. - Friendly English-speaking staff. They even have a small sign in the room offering replacements for things you might have forgotten - toothbrush, razor etc. - which indicates a very positive attitude. - Quiet, safe street. - Convenience store across the street, ATM about 200m north. The Mexican restaurant by the S-Bahn station ("Morelos") was great. Cons: - The standard bed might be a little small for anyone over 180cm tall. The mattress was too soft for my taste. - The only English TV channel is BBC World News, which has to be the most boring, repetitive, shallow news service ever. The German channels were much better (even though I didn't understand a word). - There's only one chair and not much room for a second one - not to mention a table - so you can't really eat in. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and I'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: worldecho
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and found it to be very clean and conveniently located near to the public transport system. The rooms we had were very basic, no frills accommodation which meant that there was no wardrobe as such and the double bed seemed very small indeed. Breakfast at peak times was chaos with people queuing everywhere and standing around looking for tables so try to avoid the busiest times. Our biggest issue was with the guy on reception who came across as unhelpful and unfriendly. Every time we asked him something it seemed to be an effort and the information he gave us was often incorrect (the lady on reception however was fine and very professional so we quickly learned to wait until she was free if we needed any help or advice). Overall good value but probably more suited to short-stay business users.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: VinceM88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early Aug. Very impressed with hotel and staff. Hotel well placed for S and U bahn stations - 5 mins walk from both giving access to all popular Berlin tourist places. Buy Welcome Card for great value stay. Nice brekfast buffet but busy 8-9.30! Spoke English to reception staff and found them very courteous. Tip - try the 'Fat Tyre Cycle tour' under the TV Tower in Alexanderplatz - a great way to explore the City.

Reviews.Title: “Speak German or expect to be ignored”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: This is a typical HIE, nothing more, nothing less. Good location to walk to all of Berlins attractions and some good eateries not too far away. Learn to speak German before you stay, because the staff are very rude, ignorant or condescending if you try to speak english, but if you cant speak german, make sure they know you are not american. Beware when turning on the tv with children present as the have hard core porn on a number of channels and even with the box in the middle of the screen to get you to pay, you can still see everything. Breakfast is the usual fight to get food or a table with the usual walk ins that prowl the free breakfast hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Brisboy77
Reviews.Content: if you want a clean, comfortable, centrally located hotel in berlin that you use as a base to sleep shower and have breakfast then this is the place for you. Located a comfortable 15 min walk (1 S-Bahn station) from Potsdamer Platz, this hotel is in the ideal location for berlin sightseeing. Rooms are clean and modern. Breakfast is basic, but all you need to fuel you up for a morning of sight seeing! Staff are friendly and helpful and happy to help out with direction, maps etc. Hopefully my travels will take me back to Berlin one day, if it does, i will definately base myself at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location to Central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Battota_AA
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Berlin and thank God we were lucky to get a hotel almost in the city center... in a very nice area & a great view from the hotel. Here are some points about the hotel... Positives: - eays to reach from Rail Central Station (Hbf) using bus M41 at the bus stop in front of the station - beautiful view of trees from our room in the 6th floor - room size was appropriate; not too big & not too small - shower & bathroom were well equipped - complimetary delicious breakfast - Free internet in the Lobby & there's one computer in there - the distance to Mitte & Potsdam Platz is walkable - there was a couple of supermarkets, a pharmacy and other shops... Alive street Negatives: - no entertaining English channels - the rules of internet use in the room are not reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ann_R03
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, situated centrally. You can easily use public transportation to go anywhere you like. The rooms were very clean and modern. Breakfast was not great and the breakfast area was always very crowded, but the price was low. internet was available only in public areas.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: koulla
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel. The room was okay. There was not much on the TV though, unless you can speak German. CNN was not working. The Breakfast was simple. There wasn't any scrambled eggs, bacon etc., but it had everything else, and the bread was fresh. I believe the hotel was okay based on its price. There is a nice restaurant across the road and to the left, called Diomera. It had a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: No1Ma
Reviews.Content: Not what I expected for a Holiday Inn Express. Very convenient location; easy public trans access or walking. Restaurants, bars, supermarkets, pharmacy all nearby. Too bad no mini-bar but ice available in lobby. Very nice complimentary continental breakfast; all cold food but decent and plentiful. Beds comfy; wired internet for a fee. Small bar in lobby. Would def consider this hotel again if returning to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinFairy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, the hotel is in a great location just 5 minutes walk to sony centre, and train station. Rooms are very basic and clean. When we were there it was very hot and the air con worked but it was weak, the breakfast was adequate, free wifi in the lobby,just one computer, small bar, however the hotel is very good value and ideal for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, absolutely no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: hmfrost
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated near to many of the main attractions of Berlin, and close to several S and U bahn stops. Our room had been double booked for the first night when we arrived, but we were put in a nearby hotel for a night, then moved back here for the rest of our stay. The breakfast room was a little crowded and hectic but the food was lovely and the coffee was excellent. The free internet was really useful too.

Reviews.Title: “HI Express, Berlin --- Basic but did the job”
Reviews.Author: GFCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel in Berlin. You kinda know what you're going to get with a HI Express and this was no exception. It's still a good 25-minute walk down to the major city centre sites (Brandenburg/Reichstag) but then Berlin city centre is a big place. The rooms are clean and functional although there was a rather unpleasant smell of the drainage system from the cold water tap when it was running. Not the nicest way to brush your teeth! Air conditioning was a little erratic. On site car parking is charged at €16 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, deceptive staff detracts from an otherwise basic tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: In terms of basic facilities, this comfort-priced hotel is adequate. The room, while on the smaller side, has an OK bed, small desk, and a fine bathroom. The TV was older and had a broken remote control, but did offer only 2 English channels (both news—but this is Germany, so any English language programming is appreciated). Breakfast is standard (I still remember the days when it was standard at all European hotels, which is no longer the case) and, for a cold buffet, is more than adequate. The highlight is the sophisticated coffee machines, which can make nearly every imaginable espresso drink. Location is fine—about a 5-minute walk from an S-bahn station and 10-minute walk from Potsdamer Platz and its U-bahn station or Checkpoint Charlie (and its tourist spots). My hesitation is with the staff, whose failings were numerous. Because of a change in travel plans, I needed to change the arrival and departure dates (arriving a day earlier, leaving a day later). I called the hotel and they changed the reservation. But when I checked the online record, the reservation had not been changed. When I called the hotel to correct their error, the guy at the front desk gave me a hard time, until I pointed out that his colleague was the one who made the error, not me. During the stay, the front desk staff provided inaccurate information about public transport. After convincing me to take a bus (I wanted to use the subways), they didn’t change my 20 euro note, saying that the bus driver would make change. That was not correct—it seemed that correct change was needed, as is the case in North America., But the most serious problem occurred at checkout. They tried to charge me for Internet use. I was kind of taken aback; the website specifically mentions complimentary access. Furthermore, when I connected to the net in my room, no splash page appeared warning of the charge, as is typical of all hotels. The guy at the front desk said I was supposed to be told at check in. I wasn’t. When he said that he had to charge me for the service, I told him he could, and the first thing I would do is put the charge into dispute. He relented. I went back and checked the web page—in bold face type, it says, “Complimentary Internet access” and in non-bold type (almost guaranteed to be missed), it then says, “in the lobby.” Furthermore, the site never specifically mentions there’s a charge for access in rooms. This—coupled with the failure of the staff to mention this at check-in and the lack of a splash screen warning that every other hotel (including all of the other ones in the Intercontinental chain)—makes me believe that this is a scam to scrounge up a few extra euros from clueless travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all-round”
Reviews.Author: GB40
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the HI Express and the good thing about decent quality chain hotels is that you know what to expect. Check-in was quick and easy. My room was a decent sized room with nice bathroom, comfortable bed, 20-30 channel tv with BBC World, CNN and Eurosport in English. There was the usual HI pillow selection for soft and firm which is always nice to see and there were tea/coffee-making facilities The room had it's own thermostat and you could have the big window ajar too. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a decent selection of meats and cheese for continental breakfast and ample drinks. For evening meals there is a very good selection of bars, cafes and restaurants along Stresemannstrasse with a very good wirsthaus right opposite. Transport connections are excellent with Mockernbrucke U-Bahn and Altbahnhoff S-Bahn stations both within a 10 minute walk. The M41 bus which runs to/from the main Berlin Hauptbahnhoff railway station runs right outside the hotel from early-late. As an aside, public transport in Berlin is outstanding with a day ticket ranging from 6.10-6.5 Euros for all zones on all transport; single journeys are 2.10-2.8 Euros. Several major attractions are within 30 mins walk including Brandenburger Tor, DDR Museum, Wall Museum, Friedrichstrasse, Unter-den-Linden and more. Finally, the staff in this hotel were all extremely helpful and polite including helping me with translation problems when my internal flight was cancelled. I recently stayed in a HI Express in Paris and I think this will now be the norm for me for European cities in the future. Good locations, good service and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, convenient hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rjspurling
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before - always for work. However, business or pleasure I think this Holiday Inn Express will cater to anyone. The room layout is relatively the same as many HI Express chains. This hotel has clean and comfortable rooms. The furniture and decoration is relatively modern, but the bed wasn't very comfortable. The bathroom is also very standard - clean and decent size. The room temperature was a bit hot, at 28C and a bit stuffy. In my previous stays I could open the window to get some fresh air, but you couldn't open the window in this room (room 510). You also couldn't manually control the temperature in the room. The rooms seem to be climate controlled by the hotel. For one night, I didn't make a fuss. The internet is free via Ethernet cable in your room. There is also free internet access from the hotel computer in the lobby. No wireless that I know of. Local phone calls are a bit expensive, 0.40 Euro/min. The staffs are really friendly and knowledgeable - very professional, too. Breakfast is okay, but during summer they get lots of tourists because of their great rates. I've been in situations where I've tried to have breakfast at 7 or 8am during weekdays and couldn't get a table because of all the tourists from large bus groups. Overall, I would stay here again, but with a room where you can open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Englishwanderer
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre is in a great location for visiting the sights of Berlin. Eg; Checkpoint Charlie 15 min walk the Brandenburg Gate 20 mins. Train station and underground 5 - 10 mins respectively. About 40 mins from Schoenfield Airport using shuttle bus and train to Anhalter 2.80 euros ABC area ticket is required. As it was December there were numerous Christmas markets to visit with a great atmosphere of people enjoying themselves. The hotel was clean and modern. Check in staff helpful. On entering our room it was double on the 1st floor, I pointed out that I had asked for a twin on an upper floor with a street view (like people watching). This was changed with no problem. The rooms were modern not too large but ok, although sheets were not changed on one occasion and the drink making facilities were not replenished everyday. The buffet breakfast was adequate - cereals, yogurt, meats & cheese etc. Liked the cappuchino coffee.. The breakfast area was clean and bright. The location is safe with a nice Italian restaurant opposite,also accross the street there is Aldi and Netto . I would stop there again if I ever revisited Berlin and would recommend it for a good base to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ukmary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at the end of November. When we arrived, the receptionist greeted us warmly and made us feel that we were really welcomed guests - not just customers. Our room was extremely clean (passed the bathroom 'hair in the sink test' with no problem!) and very comfortable, we even had a choice of pillows, which was great as I prefer firm ones and my husband likes them a little softer! Tea and coffee making facilities were provided. A polite notice in the bathroom advises that if you have forgotten a personal item i.e. toothbrush, razor etc. to contact reception for one. After we unpacked, we went to reception and asked another team member for directions to one of the Christmas markets. She was extremely helpful, recommended the Gendarmenmarkt as the prettiest, gave us walking instructions (approx 20 minutes at a leisurely pace) and advised us that we could take in a little sightseeing on the way as we would pass Checkpoint Charlie. Again another member of staff who treated us as very welcomed guests. The next morning we found that the kettle in the room would only work by holding your finger on the switch. After breakfast, I reported it at reception and was told a technician would be sent to fix it. It was replaced by the time we returned. Breakfast was excellent - a choice of fruit juices, tea, coffee etc. a choice of cereals, several varieties of bread for toast, a mixture of rolls, croissants, preserves, a variety of meats and cheese and pastries. Tables were cleared and cleaned as they became vacant. The restaurant staff worked quickly and very efficiently but all still with smiles on their faces. After a day’s/evenings sightseeing we returned to the hotel, looking forward to relaxing with a bottle of wine. We found that the plastic cups had not been replenished. I telephoned reception and they advised that they would get some sent up. By the time that I took to go to the ice machine and return to the room (all of four minutes!) the plastic cups had already been sent. The following morning, breakfast was again plentiful and varied. The restaurant was extremely busy but the staff worked tirelessly clearing, cleaning and replenishing breakfast items - again all staff looking very cheerful. As this was our last day, we packed and checked out, leaving our luggage at the hotel as we had a late flight. They have a room set aside for luggage which is very secure - a receipt is given for your cases, which you have to provide on collection. When we collected our luggage, the reception staff were still very welcoming, wishing us a pleasant flight etc. For us, the mark of a good hotel is how welcome you are made to feel, services provided and how quick any issues that arise are resolved. Our two minor problems were dealt with very quickly, before they could become issues. The staff here are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Berlin but not the last”
Reviews.Author: 506PIR
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short stay in Berlin with my mates and we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express located in Stressemanstrasse. I fully agree with most of the previous reports by other travellers as regards the hotel. It is a nice and modern hotel, well staffed and well located with just a ten minute walk to the lovely Potsdamerplatz and all its attractions. Well placed and at the same time, a quiet location where one can wind down and enjoy a nice rest. The breakfast was super and well varied with fresh food. Rooms were standard as one would expect with modern furniture and an excellent bathroom. Special mention is due to two of the receptionists, with no disrespect to the others but during our stay we got to know Stef and Maximillian quite well and they recommended some very good restaurants close by. Very professional young people with a great future in their chosen path. In conclusion - Berlin is fantastic. If you have never been there, then plan a trip. Stay at the Holiday Inn as you won't be disappointed. For sure I'll be going back to discover and learn more about Berlin and will book the same hotel over and over again. As I'm in the tourist business myself, a deserved 'well done' is due to the management of this hotel - You do a great job. You'll be seeing me back, sooner rather than later. Danke, gut gemacht und wir sehen uns bald.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convienient hotel”
Reviews.Author: raserfamily
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and tidy and convienient for sighseeing in the city. 15 mins walk from the Brandenburg Gate and 5 mions from the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: smithfive
Reviews.Content: Just back from a family half term break in Berlin. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Stresemannstrasse. An ideal base for visiting the sites. It is a short walk to Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie. The Anhalter Bahnhof train station is very close and it is easy to navigate the city from there. The hotel itself is very good. It is well maintained and clean, the staff are very helpful. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The rooms are standard Holiday Inn Express rooms, nothing fancy but very comfy. The only gripe we had was that our room smelt of smoke so if this bothers you be sure to ask for a no smoking room. There is also a good inexpensive pizzeria across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value City Break”
Reviews.Author: myopinionWales
Reviews.Content: I would agree wirth the vast majority of your reviewers - this is an excellent value base for a Berlin city break. It is located in a quite pleasant semi-residential area on the edge of Potsdamer Platz; within walking distance of many of the most famous sights such as the Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie etc but also close to Anhalter Banhoff S-bahn station and other transport links. There are also a range of local bars, restaurants and bistros, including some good value Italians Restaurants nearby, if you dont want to eat in the city centre and also several shops/supermarkets. Our family of five stayed in two en-suite rooms for three nights. The rooms are smallish, with limited storage space, but very modern, clean and comfortable, good range of tv channels, hospitality tray etc. The inclusive breakfast was a definite plus, with a reasonable and fresh choice of items. The bar and reception area was comfortable, with free internet, and staff were always helpful. There is a luggage room, which allowed us a full day of exploring after checking out as we could return to the hotel to pick up our bags for our evening flight. We would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: paudbrowne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights (Sept. 16-22) for the Berlin Marathon. We found it a great value hotel in an excellent location with in walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. While the rooms are small they are clean and modern like most of the hotel. The breakfast is very good with a lot of choices and there is plenty of room and time to enjoy it. with lots of tables and chairs. Anyone who has stayed in it's sister hotel in New York where there was a scramble for breakfast will know what I mean. If anyone is running next years Berlin Marathon this is with walking distance of the start. We found the staff at reception also very helpfull. Over all if you are looking for a good value hotel in Berlin this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: catharineg21
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin with two friends and chose the Holiday Inn Express because it seemed fairly central and convenient for all the sightseeing we wanted to do. As it turned out, the hotel was ideal - smallish rooms, but that wasn't a problem seeing as we were only using the hotel as a base and were out for most of the day. The room easily accommodated the three of us, including one on a sofa bed (which he found quite comfortable) and it was a bonus having a little kettle and some teabags so we could make ourselves a cup of tea in the morning or evening. It was great having a breakfast provided as it meant we could fill up and be ready for the day ahead. Also convenient was the Netto supermarket across the road, which meant we could pop over and get some snacks to keep us going during our busy days of sightseeing. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly & helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: fuznutz04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We loved it. the breakfast was good, the rooms were clean, and there was free internet access downstairs in the lobby. This is also a 3 min walk to Anhalter Banhof subway station. Potzdamer platz is the next stop. Maybe another 3 minute walk. It is very close to the Sony Center, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust memorial, and other historical sites. The staff was always helpful, and they allow you to store your luggage after you check out, which is very helpful if you have to leave the city later on and dont want to drag your luggage around the city. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just¨Perfect - could have been better”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeJumbert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel on September 2nd and 3rd for a meeting held at the Hotel. The product is really great and in a great shape, the service is excellent with employees always showing care to you and any of your request. I would definitely choose this hotel for my future stays in Berlin. The perfect place to stay to discover the incredible and beautiful city of Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay, hope to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: texasfamilyOrange_TX
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our former exchange student and her family in Berlin. They chose and booked the hotel. It was so nice to see a clean, inviting hotel lobby after what we stayed in while in Paris. The front desk personnel were very nice and accommodating. The rooms were a bit small, but since we had 4 rooms with two people in each room it was large enough. The a/c was on but it just didn't seem to keep it cool to our standards. Being from Texas where it is so hot in the summer this was the first place we stayed with a/c and were thrilled to have it. It was our first encounter with a German style breakfast buffet and we were pleasantly surprised. This was our first trip abroad and this hotel was the highlight of our trip. It was close to everything and so nice to come back to a comfortable room after a long day of sightseeing and tired feet. If we ever get back to Berlin again....this is where we wills stay. I know every stay can't be perfect, but adjust your expectations and try to enjoy it. after all, you are only sleeping there at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tlouro
Reviews.Content: The room is good. The bathroom could be more modern The location is good, the hotel is near Potsdamer Platz. The breakfast is good although the room can be a bit noisy and overcrowded Good option for a stay in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TexCymbal
Reviews.Content: This a typical Holiday Inn Express - simple and modern, but quite centrally placed. It's in a quiet commercial area, but only a short walk to Potzdamer Platz, the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Tiergarten and Unter den Linden. There are also U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations nearby. The rooms are clean, modern and bright. The continental buffet breakfast is about average but plentiful and will fuel you up for a day's sightseeing. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and gave us printed travel directions when we discovered the S-Bahn was going to be closed on the day we were heading back to the airport. Very good value for money - I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Photos_On_The_Road
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, 5 minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz, 10 minutes from Checkpoint Charlie, and few minutes from a couple of underground stations that will get you everywhere. The cozy area of Kreuzberg is just around the corner and if you land in Schoenefeld Airport, there's a fast bus+underground connection with not train changes. The hotel is modern, rooms with A/C, hair-dryer and plenty of space. Very comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: radunkar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to Postdamer Platz, easily accesible with bus from Hauptbahnof. Room was nice, clean. Breakfast according to stardard but poor selection of ham and cheese. Polite receptionist. Free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “10 min walk to Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, Staff not so good, but due to its location and price i would probably stay there again. All around good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain Hotel--With Caveats, However”
Reviews.Author: Fliingdutchmn
Reviews.Content: Don't expect too much from this hotel. I read the reviews on this site and left for my trip excited about my stay. I left quite disappointed. If you adjust your expectations, you might be happier than I. I stayed for five nights in late May 2009. The sole reason I chose this particular hotel is because it had A/C. Having lived in a big city, I know how noisy it gets with the window open. OF course, when I arrived, the A/C at this hotel was OFF. This, despite it reaching into the 80s the first few days and upwards of 90 subsequently. I was told...it is "too cold" for them to turn on the A/C in the hotel. HUH?!! The CONSTRUCTION NOISE STARTED AT 6AM EVERY MORNING. With the noise, of course came the sun through the open window. Nice vacation, huh? I relate this anecdote because it serves to illustrate the significant negatives of staying here. If you dare to ask for another pillow (you will only receive ONE when you arrive), you may be told, as I was, that "There are no more." No more pillows.....in a hotel with hundreds of guests... You may also have the pleasure of experiencing the sneering, dismissive attitude of the young, blond front desk staff. Perhaps you will, as I did, receive only blank, dull stares when you confront them with a problem. BUT, if you plan on getting up at 6AM, don't want A/C, are content with one pillow and don't dare to IMPOSE upon the front desk staff by asking for anything, you may enjoy your trip! The breakfast really is quite splendid and they deserve big kudos for their amazing espresso machines...a big bonus after a sweaty night and a 6AM wake-up via jackhammer!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good Location, Budget-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Famof4Florida
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and the breakfast was German style - rolls, meat, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, muesli, milk, juice, coffee - perfect to get you started for a day of sightseeing. Anhalter Bahnhof station is just a 10 minute walk away- on the same side of the street as the hotel - couldn't get much easier. Grocery store and lots of little restaurants across the street. We got the Berlin Welcome Card and that paid for itself with unlimited public transportation and discounts to major sights. Definitely visit the Museum House at Checkpoint Charlie, take a Fat Tire Bike Tour (fantastic way to the see the city) and ride public buses 100 & 200. Wish we could have stayed longer in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedNYS
Reviews.Content: Three adults stayed one night. Very small rooms; beds not very comfortable; very cheap towels (if that is important); shower hot water fluctuated in temperature. One adult used couch/sofa bed that was very rudimentary. Hotel is satisfactory with location one block from subway/bus line. Easy flat several block walk to Potsdamer Platz/subway/bus hub. Good place to stay if you need frugal accommodation with helpful staff. Free PC access in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 8888Geordie
Reviews.Content: Hotel in excellent position for easy walking to most of the major sites, Sony Centre at Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag and all those along Unter den Linden to Museum Island. There is a very close and convenient S-Bahn connection at Anhalter-Bahnhof. Rooms are modern, clean and good quality. There is a reconstruction site out the back but comparatively quiet. The continental breakfast is plentiful and nourishing. There is a Netto opposite and and Aldi within a few metres to the north-west along Stresemannstrasse There’s a Bar (although inevitably high prices with our present poor exchange rate) just past Aldi and a cheap (Turkish) Imbiss next to the rail station.. If flying in to Schönefeld early in the morning, get an all day travel ticket (Tageskarte for 6.30€ - need to press zones A,B and C) on the platform. [Or a seven-day for 31.30€]. There are tickets for family and group travel as well. If arriving later buy a single for zone C (2.70€). You need to take the S9 Flughafen Berlin Schönefeld-Spandau Line, get off at Friedrichstrasse (15 stops) about 30 minutes, and then get either the S1 Wannsee - Oranienberg line (direction Wanasee) for 3 stops to Anhalter-Bahnhof Or The S2 Blankenfeld – Bernau line (direction Balnkenfeld (Sudkreuz) for 3 stops to Anhalter-Bahnhof. Thoroughly recommend using the all day ticket to travel throughout the U and S Bahn but especially on the X100 or X200 buses which journey from Alexanderplatz to the Zoo and back past most of the major tourist places. In fact I’d do this bus journey twice! If at Alexanderplatz I suggest visits to Brauhaus Mitte at 13, Karl-Liebknecht Strasse, or Lemkes Spezialitätenbrauerei on Dircksenstrasse, or Marcus-Bräu at 1, Munzstrasse, or Georgbräu Brauhaus at 4, Spreeufer - if in need of decent lager; the latter has a good location overlooking the river. Personally I’d steer clear of the Weissebeers and stick to the Pils.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and good proximity to Berlin sights, but untrustworthy housekeeping staff.”
Reviews.Author: cspoe7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days during our vacation in Berlin and were happy with our choice. It is a Holiday Inn, so our expectations weren't that high (looking for an average-type of hotel) and the expectations were met. The room was good sized and a baby cot was provided. The parking was in an underground garage and was a bit overpriced, but given that the neighborhood around the hotel was a bit seedy, it was the better alternative to parking on the street. Other than the somewhat suspect neighborhood, the location was good in that it was a short walk to the main Berlin sights. One complaint I had about the hotel was their housekeeping's disregard for the privacy sign we'd hung stating that we didn't want the room made up. This violation of privacy did not result in anything notably being stolen, but it is a major breach of trust when someone enters your room without your consent. When I brought this to the attention of the Holiday Inn staff, they said the housekeeping was contracted out and they'd file a note with them to make sure it didn't happen again; I was told I could not speak with the company directly which was also frustrating. If I returned to Berlin, I'd probably look to stay elsewhere where I could get better parking rates (if I needed to park) in a better neighborhood. If the Holiday Inn was considerably cheaper, I'd consider staying again, but I'm not confident in the current leadership team based on my previous experience.

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: Revier
Reviews.Content: Arrived in morning and booked into room immediately by pleasant young man on reception. Double room was small and just enough space for our two pieces of hand luggage. Only problem was when we turned the shower controls and no water came through. Reported this to reception and were dealt with in a very frosty manner. After three visits to reception a member of staff was sent to our room and explained that the shower head had to be turned in addition to the 'on' control.. This is something we have not encountered before. The girls on reception could easily have explained this and all would have been well. They spoke good English so there was no language problem. The hotel is in a good location as described in previous reviews. All areas of the hotel were spotless and the breakfast food fresh and quickly restocked.

Reviews.Title: “Great simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgie01
Reviews.Content: This was a great budget hotel and would choose to stay in again. Room was simple but clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Like the fact that breakfast avaliable until 11.30, although I understand why since one morning we went for breakfast about 9am and it was so packed we sat at the bar to eat which was fine. The location is perfect and agree with others that talk of the italian restaurant across the road. Would recommend to anyone for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Room was clean, and comfortable. Bath was spotless. TV was limited in channels and only offerred BBC in English. Internet connection was available in room but again very expensive. Free computer offerred in lobby as well as complimentary wifi. Excellent buffett breakfast in the morning. One slight complaint, the towels in the room were well used, very thin and tired looking. Upgrading the towels would make an enjoyable stay even a more pleasant experience. Transportion almost at the door. Walk to Potsdamplatz in 15 minutes, and there is a piece of the old Berlin wall located just to the left of the hotel. The hotel does seem to cater to large tourist groups, no problem, but the breakfast hall is filled in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped reviews on a very average hotel (construction site beside the hotel!)”
Reviews.Author: Doc2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel at the end of February for 3 nights with my wife, from Friday until Monday. I knew that would be a basic standard 3* star hotel but after reading all the great reviews I thought it would be worth booking. The location of the hotel is very good, as it is close to Postdamer Plaz and Checkpoint Charlie etc. We arrive around 2pm on Friday and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist so the 1st signs seemed positive. We were given a room on the 2nd floor although I had requested a higher floor and it was a smoking room although I had asked for a non smoking room on the booking. That was fine as we were excited to be in Berlin and wanted to start seeing the city. My Mom then looked out the window to see there was a large construction site beside the hotel. As it was Friday we thought there would be no work going on over the weekend so decided not to change rooms. This was a mistake as at 7am on Saturday morning, four workmen arrived and start making a hell of a noise. I went down to reception at 7.30 am to request a different room away from the noise and was not impressed with the attitude of the receptionist. She did agree to change the room and we received a room on the 5th floor away from the construction site later that day. The hotel should really be informing people about the construction site when making bookings and they were not interested in hearing this when we were leaving on Monday. My wife speaks german so it was not down to a language barrier. The rooms in the hotel are fine, basic but that is what I expected. The carpets and blankets in the rooms are old. The bed is comfortable but the quilt is very light and we had to request extra pillows. The breakfast is good, nothing to get excited about but does the job to start a day of sightseeing. This really is a very average hotel and I really don`t get the other reviews on this site. Of course for the price I should only except an average hotel but after reading all the reviews I really was looking forward to staying in the hotel. IBIS Hotel are in the same area closer to the U Bann and would be a better option. One thing I do agree with about the other reviews is the Italian Restaurant across the road from the hotel. The food is great and so cheap, we live in Dublin so were shocked at the prices and the quality of the food. The customer service in the restaurant is 1st class and they could teach the staff in the hotel how to behave. Berlin is a great city, and we will return and maybe even stay in the same area but not in Express Hotel Inn. Also one tip Berlin has some great places to see, but make sure to check the Film Haus in the Sony center it is a brilliant museum. Shane

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Gottx
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for two nights last weekend and cannot fault this hotel. We had a twin room which cost £25 per person per night and included buffet breakfast. Hotel was spotlessly clean, nicely furnished and designed, and staff were extremely friendly. Continental style breakfast was fine, as were the fuctional, yet well designed rooms. A number of underground stations are in the vicinity - one about two hundred metres away - and it's a 10 minute walk to Potzdamer Platz and not much more for Brandeburg Gate. We had an absolutely fantastic time in Berlin, finding it to be a really interesting, friendly, and easy navigable place. The public transport is good value, and the hotel was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel for weekend trippers to Berlin - I will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless..”
Reviews.Author: Joe723
Reviews.Content: This is a no bullshit hotel that provides a great service in an efficient, unfussy manner. It is spotlessly clean, and quiet (1 inch think double glazed windows). The breakfast is unbeatable and is available until 11.30 Sunday's and 10.30 on Monday's. Any requests we had were more than met by the friendly reception staff. I don't think you will find a better value hotel - had I paid an extra 30 euros per night I would still have been very happy. It is a brisk 15 minute walk to the train station, which is worth bearing in mind. I never used the bus service. The location is good as it is in a nice area which we might never had visited if we had based ourselves in the 'more fashionable' hotel district. All in on this was a serious thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ethanEngland
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin to see in the New Year. The double room was very clean and well furnished however the duvet needed to be wider with more overhang. The location was excellent with an Underground station two minutes away and Brandenburg Gate an easy twenty minute walk. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Several restaurants are situated in the vicinity and a handful of convenient stores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy small room but...”
Reviews.Author: Petitv
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 4am and wanted to check in 1 day earlier. We were told that the hotel was fully booked, however the 2 male staff assisted us to call other hotels nearby to check for availability, they even offered us hot drinks to freshen up. After 30 minutes, we were told that no rooms were available at nearby hotels too. The reception staff tried their best to assist us then finally they mntioned that a guest did not turn up and we could check in. We were so impressed with their services. The room was small but was comfortable for the 3 of us. What disppointed us was our room was not tidy up for our last 2 nights of stay and used towels were piling up in the toilet. Not too sure if the chamermaid really forgot to clean up our room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: tamg28
